item.title: Ticket #3475 (Publish fails during auto-save) created
item.dc:creator: alexkingorg
item.description:
It seems that if you hit Publish while an auto-save is in process, the post is saved into Draft status. I've been using 2.1alpha for a month or two now and I run into this several times per week - just caught it in action to see what was really happening.

It's kind of a bad bug because it's easy to miss that the post is back in the drafts list (assuming you have a few drafts as I do).

item.title: Ticket #3419 (Multiple Authors for 1 article) updated
item.dc:creator: filosofo
item.description: I offered above to send Martin-FR my multiple authors plugin, and I never heard from him. So he must not be too concerned about it.

item.title: Ticket #3419 (Multiple Authors for 1 article) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Ease of incorporation is pretty low on our list of criteria for incorporating a feature into WP core.

It could be done with a plugin without editing the template for simple views of multiple authors.

For complex views of multiple authors, the loop structure is most flexible, and that requires editing the theme.

I said I'd think about updating the plugin once 2.0.6 and 2.1 are out.

item.title: Ticket #3002 (On Windows machines register_activation_hook() does not work if plugin ...) updated
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description:
Keywords changed

The release of 2.1 is nearby, therefore people don't want to change anything "major" anymore for that release, but just get it stable and out of the door.

The 2.2 version will have a much shorter release time than 2.1 has had. It's expected to be around 4-6 months after the 2.1 release, so pushing this back to 2.2 doesn't mean you'll have to wait very long for it to be incorporated.

Also providing patches helps getting things in faster. We can't fix anything without somebody creating a patch.

item.title: Ticket #3002 (On Windows machines register_activation_hook() does not work if plugin ...) updated
item.dc:creator: McShelby
item.description: Why is there no interest in fixing this hook with the next *gasp* "major" version of WP?

  3. ...the plugin doesn't work.

I forgot the attachment.

item.title: Ticket #3474 (misc i18n improvements) created
item.dc:creator: nbachiyski
item.description:
Among these:

  • Consolidating some strings (the ERROR prefix)
  • js_escapes
  • some plural things: ngettext rename to the shorter n
  • text/wording fixes

Expect some more in the coming days. I wanted to try with a smaller chunk of them first.

Please review before comitting :)

item.title: Ticket #3473 (Global Categories) closed
item.dc:creator: andy
item.description:
invalid:

Global categories at wordpress.com unifies the categories of many blogs. How you mean to apply that to WordPress is a mystery and you do not cite a specific plugin. This does not work as a feature request.

Please expand on your ideas and reopen this ticket.

item.title: Ticket #3473 (Global Categories) created
item.dc:creator: corourke
item.description: Is it possible to add global categories ala wordpress.com. There is a hack/plugin available however for this being essentially a community application it seems that this function should be part of the core framework with perhaps a admin disable feature in the site admin tools. Having this in the site would also allow using the search widget to search the entire site as opposed to just the blog.
